  4541. Less is more (too much is a little greasy).
  4542. Left beard very soft but a little greasy at first.
  4543. />This is a leave-in conditioner, as the site label asserts, so to really receive the complete benefit of using such a product, it is necessary to put it in sometime in the morning and leave it in for at least eight or nine hours, but I generally leave it there until right before I decide to climb into bed.
  4544. I read that it very much resembles black licorice, which I think is spot on.
  4545. ; I work a tiny amount into my wet hair and it adds just the right amount of hold and doesn't leave a residue on your hands if you run them through your hair later.
  4546. Second, in either form (oil or solid) the product will coat your fingers and washing does not really get it off right away.
  4547. Only a small amount is necessary to moisturize the beard and easy to apply.
  4548. It certainly does make my beard softer, and as other reviewers have written, the scent eventually fades.<br /><br
  4549. This product really works, beard feels soft and has a slight scent of licorice.
  4550. However, I discovered that for mysize of beard, I need less than a fingertip's worth of balm to work through and condition my entire beard.
  4551. My facial foliage is now so thick and strong

  4553. I've never used a product like this, despite having a beard for more than 30 years, but lately I've been letting it get a little longer and regular hair conditioners don't really do much.
  4554. This is the first time I have had a beard longer than a half inch.

  4556. I'm about half way through my first jar.
  4557. for the first half hour or so after applying, which I don't mind.<br />Will

  4559. I've been using the same tin for a solid near two months and I am a believer!

  4561. The tin is pretty big compared to two other balms I've tried.
  4562. Smell is not what some people make it out to be, it is a something different, but it only lasts a little bit and its NOT BAD.
  4563. If a few hairs decide to pop back out later in the day, or if I just want to bask in the softness and nice aroma, I sometimes pull out the comb and brush it a few times.
  4564. Only tip warm in your hard 1st or the beads wont breaks down.
  4565. Very nice consistency, works well with a faint black licorice scent.
  4566. and putting this stuff on, it gets really soft and much easier to make neat with a little stroking.
  4567. As for the cost being a little expensive, I was happy to see that it is made here in the USA.
  4568. did not expect an odor, and while I don't mind it much, I am inclined to try other products.
  4569. The greasiness described by other reviewers hasn't been a problem for me, but I would expect that they are just using too much.

  4595. A little bit goes a long ways, and as a result, I suspect I'll easily get another winter season out of my single container.<br /><br

  4657. I used to have 6-7 long hairs come off every stroke, now I usually just get the one occassional hair, which means less hair is coming out, and spending more time growing.

All Reviews

  1. As others have said, it smells great and feels great after you apply. I had been using this for a while, and I was slightly disappointed with the results. My beard is short so I thought maybe it wasn't doing much for me. It felt like my beard was only marginally softer after using almost a whole tin in regular applications. However, when I stopped using it, my beard became way scratchier and rougher within a couple weeks of not using the product. I realized that the beard balm softened my beard gradually, so I didn't notice a huge difference day to day, but when I stopped I realized just how much of a difference this stuff makes. Highly recommended, but once you start using it you won't want to stop!
  2. I bought this 3 months ago, and have used it almost every day. I can finally see the bottom of the 2 oz tin, should have a week or so left. I have about 3' of length currently, so that should let you gauge about how long the tin will last for you. This has a good amount of hold, but it isn't quite enough for my very curly beard. I am switching to the Heavy-Duty version after this can is gone. I have been very pleased with this product and brand, and I would recommend it to anyone without hesitation.
  3. I youse it every morning works great .
  4. Excellent product. A must have for the bearded man! Makes my beard softer and smoother and easier to brush through.
  5. Use it every day.. Smells good and works..
  6. Quick shipping, nice packaging. Make sure you read the instructions, especially if you live in a warm climate.<br />All in all, I think it's a great product. It recommended to me by a buddy that has a monster beard and I know now why.<br />It's easy to apply, and helps with the coarse hairs and the itching of the dreaded neck beard. If you are constantly itching, especially in the first couple of weeks of growing your hair, I would apply this 2x a day and you will be relieved!
  7. I've been using this conditioner for roughly the past 6 months, daily, while I grew a beard from scratch. It works wonderfully and smells great. Now I can't go a day without.
  8. After my first use my beard was a lot softer and looked thicker. I enjoy the smell as well, not overpowering. Its a very light hold, just enough to reign in some of the wild hairs that pop up from time to time and allows for some very light shaping. If you're looking for a more intense hold you'll need something with more wax.
  9. Works well for control and moisturising. If it melts and rehardens it can clump up a bit which is anoyingly. Not my favorite smell but not a bad smell..
  10. I was very hesitant to try another product like this. The last few I tried had a very lingering smell and left a film. Honest Amish Beard Balm is amazing. The smell is very soft and pleasant. After one full week people have complimented me on my beard and I owe all of it to this product. Im getting ready to buy several 4 oz cans so I never run out. You have a Customer for Life.
  11. Best I've tried - and I feel like I've tried them all!!
  12. I love this brand of beard balm. It helps my beard straighten out and look longer. The smell reminds me of a clean dirty-hippie. (Good smell) The only bad quality about this product is my dog, a Boxer breed, loves this stuff. I'm thinking to myself, \\"Wow! My dog really loves me! Ohhh WAIT! STOP LICKING MY BEARD DOG!\\" I would recommend getting two cans if you own a dog like me. Only because when I'm sleeping, I wake up to my dog licking the beard balm out my beard. I mean whatever, she's a dog. But then my beard looks like rodents have been playing in it and trying to make beard angels. No big deal. Just wash your face and put some more Honest Amish beard balm to your beard. Beard will look puppy-free and looking nice for the beard loving ladies. Disclaimer: No dogs or rodents were harmed in the making of this review.
  13. This stuff is great. Definitely will buy again. I don't even use it every day and it has kept my beard &#34;down&#34;; not having hairs going every which way. And like I said, I don't use it every day but even on the off days, when I comb my beard it just stays in place.<br /><br />As for how it smells: Yes, in the can it definitely has a sort of medicinal herbal smell. Kinda reminds me of jaegermeister actually. I am not a huge fan of the smell, or at the very least would not want to smell like that if this were a cologne. But within a few minutes of putting this on the smell quickly goes away. Just don't use too much. I know it seems like a little bit spread out over a full beard won't do anything but it does. I use an amount equal to the size of my finger tip, rub it in my palm a bit and then put it in my beard. I expect at this rate of usage this little can will last me a while and I will definitely purchase again.
  14. Love this stuff, on my second can. Beard is soft and smells good.

  26. My boyfriend has been 'tirelessly working' to grow out a beard to be proud of...it started looking a bit scraggly this winter, and he became miserable - even suggesting he was going to shave it all off. I knew he didn't mean it, that he was frustrated but he'd hate himself for shaving it...so bought this stuff for him as a last-ditch effort to get him to (shut up) like his beard again. Truth be told, I've noticed a difference, too; when he uses the beard balm his beard looks much fuller and shinier. It's easier to manage, and doesn't look all scraggly.<br /><br />It worked! He loves it, uses it every day now...and it kind of has a manly herby scent without being overpowering or smelling like patchouli. Placing another order now - 3 months later - because he's almost out.

  30. This product solved my problem with flakey skin under my beard. My wife is very sensitive to product scents but she loved this so much she made me look to see if Honest Amish had soap with the scent (they don't--hint, hint).   31. I bought this with hopes the it would give me beard a sleeker and more well-maintained look. It satisfies thoroughly in this respect. My beard hairs, which are rather thick individually, are tamed and smoothed by the product.<br /><br />There were also several reviews that complained about the scent. I thought it was a fairly strong scent the first time I applied the balm, but I liked the scent. It is a woodsy, earthy smell and honestly I'm completely okay with it. My girlfriend also commented that she thought the smell was woodsy and manly. Again, while it is strong at first application, the scent dwindled shortly after but there was still a definite presence of the smell. I however don't mind the smell at all (I rather like it, actually) so this is of no consequence to me whatsoever.

  33. First time growing beard, and I can tell the difference along the proces: similar (and analogous) effect as when using lip balm on chapped lips. Totally recommended!
  34. Smells like total ass.
  35. I was skeptical but it really does work as advertised. This winter is the first time I grew a beard. I have really dry facial skin so I was expecting beard dandruff and was pleasantly surprised when it didn't happen. Usually my skin is better as the temperature warms but that is actually when my dandruff started. I was using beard oil twice a day and still getting white flakes all over my shirts. I was constantly &#34;popping&#34; my shirt to shake off the flakes.<br /><br />I just got my Honest Amish last weekend and it immediately solved my issue. I put a surprisingly small amount in my beard in the morning and am good the rest of the day. I wouldn't say it has completely gone away but I went from a dandruff scale of 8 (out of 10) to maybe a 1 so I can live with that. I struggle with head dandruff as well so I don't honestly expect anything to work 100%.<br /><br />I was initially concerned because the tin is a little smaller than I expected but you really do need a very small amount. Even a dime-sized amount would be way too much for me (though my beard is pretty short). I don't have a long beard so I can't speak to the products other benefits but I will testify it works for the dreaded beard dandruff. It was getting to the point I was thinking about shaving my beard if I couldn't get it under control.
  36. Does an ok job of softening my beard which is what I was going for. Wish it worked a little better, and I am not a fan of the scent
  37. This is a really good product. I have a full naturally white beard and this balm has helped to grow and kept it soft feeling
  38. Pleasant smell, leaves my beard shiny and manageable, definitely a man's man product.
  39. Great product. Improved the softness and appearance of my beard.
  40. Good product. My beard is much softer and this is really easy to use. Although another fragrance would be nice.
  41. This stuff is good , not strong smelling
  42. This stuff was made by Grizzley Adams himself. Unbelievable, Instantly softens and conditioned my beard. I recently tried Grave Before Shave beard balm and it actually made my beard stiffer and unbearable. Couldn't even go a week before I had to order Honest Amish again. Out right majestic. Just buy it. Its worth every penny and then more.
  43. This product is great for the early stages of beard growth as it reduces itching and it definitely makes the hair look and feel healthy as you gain some length. It has an interesting texture and the smell is nice but hard to describe and may not be for everyone.
  44. I have been trying to get away from giving 5 star reviews. I think that a three should be considered a good score because (I believe) it means that the product is doing what you purchased it for. Therefore a 4 should be beyond what you expect, and a 5 should be reserved for those very few cases when a product or service does something really outstanding and beyond your expectations.<br /><br />So after considering it for a while I decided to give the product a 5. My reasoning for it is because I don't think that I could tolerate my beard without it. This is the first time I have had a beard longer than a half inch. It always drives me nuts when it gets about that long. Now I have about 2 inches of beard, and I can't wait to put this stuff on to make it more comfortable. It just feels soothing and nice. So while it doesn't make me breakfast in bed, it makes my beard not only tolerable but pleasurable. My wife loves to play with it when I have the conditioner in, and that is a good thing ;-)
  45. working pretty good so far.....leaves my beard nice and soft----and that is a really big change from before when I was not using it.
  46. Very happy with this so far. it's only been a little over a week and already my beard is beginning to feel softer, which makes the wife happier, and no more itching. I like the aroma it gives off at first when you apply it and that it only takes a little to go along way. The price was very fair in my opinion with what else is out there. I would definitely recommend. This is my first beard conditioner so once I'm done with this, I will try something else though so I have something to compare it to.

Let it grow out to where it just starts to itch and then I trim it down to just about naked. Been doing this for years.<br /><br />So as luck would have it. I'm sitting at my desk one day and rub my beard. I look down and it appears to be snowing. I'm thinking \\"dandruff?\\" So I apply a bit of head and shoulders and that doesn't work. Now, I'm panicked, because I am constantly in front of people. So I look up this stuff on Amazon and voila!<br /><br />I was sold after one usage. Wow! It's amazing. Take a little and rub it into your palms. Rub that into your beard and that ended that. No more snow. My wife loves how soft my beard feels even on days when her skin is sensitive.<br /><br />This product is the bomb! I will definitely order again.

  106. This is a great product! I was looking at other beard oils to get and this had the most reviews and most positive reviews. I've never used a beard oil before but I now know that this is a must have for any guy growing a beard. I used to shampoo and condition my beard to stop the itch. That didn't work. Tried a leave-in hair conditioner, that didn't work either and made my beard flaky. After using this I'll never be without it!<br /><br />This product mixes well. I apply after the shower getting my beard towel dry and then I pinch a small amount out at a time. It takes a few seconds to get the granules to smooth out. They remind me of caviar. But once it's turned to oil in my hands I apply to my beard. I go against the grain, in circles and then smooth it back down. Any of the excess I use on my face and arms. You can actually use certain oils (like all the ones contained in Honest Amish) on your face to moisturize (it wont cause breakouts) instead of lotions with who knows what in them.<br /><br />The look - My beard looks a little wet after applying but it soon dries. My beard looks healthy and manly.<br /><br />The smell - I took one star off for this. But smell is subjective anyway. Is it awful? No! Do I love it? No. Some have said this has a licorice like smell to it. The only time I noticed it is when I put it on for the very first time. Since then I haven't really noticed it. I don't really know how to describe the smell other than it smells like a new 2x4. I would've liked something with more of a scent to it but again it's not awful.<br /><br />Does it work? - Yes! This takes away 95% of my beard itch! And my beard looks great!

  123. This wasn't exactly what I expected, but then again, I don't know what I was expecting. What exactly is a 'balm' anyway? A lotion? A paste? Regardless, I am a convert now. What comes is a small tin containing a very granular and almost gritty paste. At first I didn't see how this would infuse into my beard. However, as soon as I put a small amount, enough to cover the pad of my middle finger tip, I could feel it 'melting'. All you need to do is gently rub it between your first two fingers of each hand for about 10-15 seconds. The 'grit' will fall off your fingers if you rub too quickly before it starts to melt. The balm soon starts to melt and you're left with a thick oil on your finger tips. Just work it from the bottom of your beard, going against the 'grain', towards the top. Really work it in all over; neck, mustache, cheeks, everywhere. All you have to do now is comb or smooth your beard. At first it may feel a little 'greasy' but this quickly passes as the balm soaks into your beard and skin. In about an hour you won't be able to stop touching it. It really feels nice. After around three days you'll notice a real difference in how your beard lays on your skin and how it feels. Some people don't like the smell, but I've grown to like it. It isn't perfume-y at all and is very subtle.<br /><br />Highly recommend!!
  124. does smell a little like licorice, not too bad though. seems to be doing its job, no complaints here.
  125. Pretty good product just wish you would get more than what was delivered.
  126. I'm a Filipino dude and I've grown a pretty full beard, over an inch long. My Asian genes left me with facial hair that is very straight and thick. I also tend to sleep on my face. This means that I wake up every morning with a wiry mess to deal with. After showering (no soap on the beard!) and putting this stuff on, it gets really soft and much easier to make neat with a little stroking. Personally, I like the scent. It's faintly beeswaxy.<br /><br />The only downside I can think of is because of the straightness, thickness, and blackness of my beard, the balm can make it glisten in direct light. It might sound a little majestic but it's not. It just looks wet sometimes. It's worth it, though.

  138. Honest Amish has the texture of a sugary paste with a light oily base. But when you rub it into your fingers and beard, you don't get a greasy feeling, unless you use too much. It works well, much like many of the other balms on the market. This wasn't my favorite, though. It has a very distinct anise/clove/black licorice scent that can be sickening at times, especially as the smell dissipates, and then you get an odor that smells like black licorice melting in vegetable oil, or something like that. I know Honest Amish doesn't use artificial fragrance, and that's fine. But this \\"natural\\" smell isn't that great. I'd give it two stars because of the smell, but I can see many others like the smell, and it wouldn't be fair to give it too low of a rating because of my aromatic preferences. Although it helps your beard stay soft and manageable, it also smells funky. So, yes, three stars: \\"It's okay.\\"

  179. I've used this product for almost two months and its done wonders for my beard and mustache. It took about two weeks to really notice a difference.<br /><br />My wife always complained that my mustache was so coarse it made her eyes water when the little hairs poked her upper lip, near her nose. Honest Amish has alleviated this problem almost completely.<br /><br />Now after a good washing and conditioning in the shower, I rub a little Honest Amish around on the palm of my hand and smooth it through my beard and mustache.<br /><br />NOTE: A little goes a long way. If you use too much and have a tendency to play with your beard as I do, you will end up making things you touch afterwards a little greasy/smudgy-looking. (Sunglasses, phones, etc) I figure this is my fault not the product's, after all my stuff wouldn't be smudgy if I didn't touch my beard all the time.<br /><br />If your beard/mustache is exceptionally coarse or damaged, you may need to give it a good trim to remove the hair that is beyond repair by a product like this. I've trimmed a 1/4 \\"off three times now, and each time the hair gets softer and softer. Just a thought...<br />Love this product!

  184. Great product for taming and conditioning beard. Easy to use and effective. I bought some as a gift for my son too. I happily recommend it.
  185. I have about a 3 month beard going. This is the first time I have ever grown a real beard so you could say that I am an amateur beardsman. I had gone a few weeks without shaving before, but never like this. &#34;No shave November&#34; has come and gone and I do not see myself shaving off my beard for some time.<br /><br />Wow, I never knew how much goes into growing a proper beard. Two months of growth in I started to feel like my beard was naturally getting a bit unruly and decided to look for beard growing advice online. What I found were YouTube videos describing the proper combs, scissors, trimmers oils etc. I looked to Amazon and ordered the two beard oils/balms with the highest ratings to compare and can say that I prefer Honest Amish balm over the other product I ordered that had very slightly higher ratings.<br /><br />This product comes in a soft, yellowish solid form. With your finger you dig out a bit maybe twice as large as a pea and rub it in between your palms. Although if feels a bit gritty at first, it quickly melts into a nice, smooth oil. Apply to a damp beard, by rubbing it in gently and then comb for a more styled, clean look. You beard will instantly look more vibrant, clean, and refined. The other product that I bought simply labeled as &#34;Beard Oil&#34; will give similar results, but I felt that I had to use more than the recommended amount to get the same results. I think that this product gives a nicer visible result, but what separates them more than anything is THE SMELL.<br /><br />Obviously smells come down to personal preference much of the time, but I think that this product smells AMAZING. I can only describe it is a spicy smell similar to sassafras. Perhaps it is anise, but I don't really think it smells like black licorice. The smell will dissipate after some time, but it does linger for a while. Since I bought this product just a month ago, I have had two ladies complement my smell and ask what cologne I am wearing. They seemed shocked when I told them it is product I put in my beard. Also had one lady compliment my beard and tell me how clean it looked literally seconds after walking into a bar this past weekend.

  200. OVERVIEW: Winter time means hibernation time, which means I use it as an excuse to let myself go for 5 months out of the year. However, growing a beard is an annoying thing because it would always get scratchy as it grew out. Until this point, I had no idea beard oils, conditioners and balms were a thing. But my five minutes of research concluded that this was one of the best-reviewed beard balms on Amazon so it had to be good enough for me. PROS: * Solid -- This stuff starts in a solid form and melts in your hands, which makes it a lot easier to put into your beard than most other oils * Amish -- They have epic beards. They make this. This is not a coincidence * Au Naturel -- It's made with nothing but the exotic oils, herbs and spices of Amish lore SOMEWHERE IN THE MIDDLE: * Scent -- This is a personal preference, but if you like the smell of Jagermeister, you'll like the smell of this CONS: * No Prime Shipping -- At least at the time I bought it, but it's worth it none the less BOTTOM LINE: 1000 reviews don't lie. Treat your face pubes right and get this. It's hands-down the best stuff and you'll wonder how you managed to grow a beard without it. This has been part of my 365 Review Revue: 1 review a day, with humor along the way.

The smell remained strong all day. And no, I didn't put it on very thick. When I first put it on my beard I had my wife smell it, she said, &#34;Eww!&#34; Not the effect I was looking for! I told her that the smell would dissipate over time. She got home about five or six hours later and she still said, &#34;Eww.&#34; Even more than that, when it goes on your mustache it's right below your nose. The product's ad did not say it was unscented and they describe it as being made with essential oils. That is going to have a stronger scent. So I guess my problem is mostly with the answers that were given by others that have bought it. I think the company should mention a bit about the strong scent.

This product is in a solid form, but quickly melts into liquid when you rub it between your hands before application. I don't think I'm going back to oils after using this balm.<br /><br />Honest Amish is quality stuff for the price. It made his beard oily and funny smelling but neither of us could feel a difference even with months of continued usage. We even tried to shave his beard and apply the product as the new hair grew in, but there has been no noticeable improvement. If anyone has any suggestions on other products we could try, please let us know!

  361. Don't fear the beard!<br /><br />For many years, I've had a soul patch that was my identifying feature. I've always been interested in growing a full grown beard but after awhile it would get all itchy and unbearable. I'd end up scratching at my beard like a dog with fleas. So, I'd shave it off and return to the trusty soul patch.<br /><br />Inspired by the advice of some female friends who encouraged me because they all agreed I have the face for a beard I was determined to beget a full-grown beard and endure the itchy stage. So, I did a little research and stumbled upon this Honest Amish beard balm. Being the Beatnik, hippie type of dude, I liked the fact it was an all natural conditioner with organic oils and fruit and nut butters. There are no man-made chemicals or preservatives. The beard balm is also packaged in 100% recyclable materials. All of this was important to me. I only want authentic ingredients to mix in with my beautiful bearded hair.<br /><br />So, with my first application, I am immediately awakened by the intense woodsy, manly fragrance. I was concerned it might be too strong but nobody's ever mentioned anything to me about the fragrance. Being that my beard is right under my nose, I anticipate it only smells strong to me.<br /><br />Most importantly, the fragrance is fanning from all natural ingredients. There are no fake fragrances or colorants in this beard balm. Therefore, what you smell and see is organic and pleasant.<br /><br />In addition, the itchiness is immediately dissipated and perishes with each application to your beard. I can now fully enjoy my beard in all its heavenly fullness.<br /><br />It smells great. It softens the beard. It nourishes the hair. It works wonders. It will be the only beard balm I ever use.

  369. I absolutely love this stuff! I discovered it a few months into growing a beard last year. My beard was a bit dry and I had split ends. This really helped keep things conditioned and soft. Plus it was easy to use and didn't have any offensive scent or texture to it, just moisturizing love for my beard. I ended up shaving that beard and starting over because I wasn't happy with the shape, and this time I used Honest Amish Beard Balm from day 1. It made a HUGE difference! First off, I never went through any uncomfortable itchy stage as had always happened before. Second, the beard grew in thicker and faster than before - only 6 months to reach the same length it had been after 9 months before, and the hair remained straighter and tangle free with fewer split ends. And finally, my beard is thicker and stronger than ever before.<br /><br />A couple of tips - read the instructions and follow them because they really do work. A little really does go a long way - one small tin still lasts me a few months even as my beard has gotten longer. And over brushing or combing will still cause split ends - it is best to run through liberally with your fingers first and then only brush or comb briefly after the balm has been applied to get everything into place/shape.

  374. I was extremely skeptical about dropping $15 on a beard product, however, after using this balm for 2+ weeks, I am happy I did! I have a sensitive nose and tend to get migraines with high-fragrance anything. That was my main concern. But this scent is great! It's light on the nose, doesn't linger for hours, and is actually quite pleasant. My wife really enjoys the smell as well!<br /><br />I bought it for two main purposes: To tame the rogue hairs, and help soften my beard. In 2 weeks, I can truthfully say this stuff works well. I have curly beard hair, which creates a mess of crazy hairs! This balm allows me to tame my beard and keep the hairs running in one direction. Keep in mind it's not a miracle worker; it won't make curly hair straight! However it has enough strength to keep them from sticking up and out! It also does a good job &#34;softening&#34; your beard. Beard hair is very coarse. Prior to this, I had the dreaded &#34;beardruff&#34; going. It hurt to scrub my beard with shampoo as I tried to cure that problem. But after 2 weeks of this balm, my hair is much softer to the touch. Again, don't be dumb; it's not a miracle worker. Your hair is still going to be coarse! But it absolutely moisturizes and keeps the hair looking and feeling healthy! My beard doesn't hurt to rub anymore. And the beardruff is no longer there. The balm gives a nice sheen/shine to your beard also, which makes it look healthier to the naked eye.<br /><br />Why 4 stars? I so badly wanted to give this a 5-star rating and if I was single, I could! However, while the balm works wonders for me, it has negatively affected my wife. After kissing her with this balm in my mustache, she breaks out around her lips. We tried the process of elimination to determine the cause and sure enough, it's the balm. I saw some other negative reviews about people having an allergic reaction to this. It seems my wife is one of those.<br /><br />I now have a tough choice ahead of me: To balm or not to balm? Balm and feel good/look good but no kissing? Or no balm while looking like a homeless beard but kissing (or is that counter-productive...will she want to kiss me if I have the whole homeless beard thing going)?? Oh decisions, decisions......

The balm is tan in color and appears to be tiny beads, I usually use the side of a dime. When you scoop a little bit of the balm out of the container and rub it in your palms, the beads turn into an oil. I apply it to my beard when I get out of the shower and it is still a little moist. The balm has an interesting floral scent that is not overpowering and a little goes a long way. The balm gives your beard a little shine and leaves it so much softer. The smell isn't strong, I think its a clean smell but nothing I can even notice after a hour or so. Nobody could smell it even in close proximity.<br />2. The consistency is kinda like chunky honey or chunky lotion, feels like honey with bits of wax in it before its mixed in your hands.<br />3. I put about a pea size in my hand, mixed my hands together as if I was trying to warm up my hands outside in the cold and the Beard Balm turned into a oil, I then rubbed it into my short beard and it made it look great! I'm cursed with EXTREMELY coarse hair (a downside of my Hispanic heritage) and this product has worked reasonably well in softening it.   526. Excellent product, exceeds expectations, but please BEWARE: LEAVE THIS AT HOME!!!<br /><br />I was traveling for the most important date of my life; the day I would marry my sweetheart of 4 years. I had MAJOR problems at the airport as a result of my decision to bring this product. I missed my flight and the wedding had to be rescheduled the following week. Needless to say, family and friends couldn't make a second trip and we had to conduct our nuptials on the stairs of the courthouse. Not the special day that my wife had hoped and dream of!!!!<br /><br />This catastrophe can be traced back to my decision to pack Honest Amish in my luggage. It was included in my carry-on bag which I brought through the security checkpoint at my local airport. Before leaving, I had transferred 2 oz. of this conditioner into a small plastic bottle and placed the bottle into a clear bag as TSA guidelines dictate. Nevertheless, the unusual nature of this product aroused the suspicion of the TSA agents. I don't know if it was the texture or unique fragrance or random chance, but I was pulled out of line as they conducted a thorough search of my things.<br /><br />With surgical precision, the agent pulled apart my carefully packed items, including some male undergarments which were a surprise for my soon-to-be wife. Finally she came upon the clear plastic bag. With latex covered hands she carefully pried open the zip-lock and fished out the plastic bottle. At this point I was nervous and humiliated.<br /><br />She demanded, &#34;What is this?&#34;<br />&#34;A personal product&#34;, I replied.<br /><br />I think I should point out here that I've never had the ability to cultivate much facial hair. In fact, the sparse growth on my lip and chin are somewhat embarrassing.<br />Thus, I wasn't willing to admit to a stranger that this was a product for my 'beard' Her tone got irritated.<br /><br />She asked again more forcefully, &#34;What IS this?&#34;<br /><br />Thoroughly humiliated, I mumbled, &#34;It's a beard balm...&#34;<br /><br />Apparently, she couldn't this make out.<br /><br />&#34;WHAT?!&#34;, she barked.<br /><br />Finally, the stress got the better of me and spoke angrily - or rather, yelled:<br /><br />&#34;IT'S A BALM!&#34;<br /><br />At that point things went off the rails. I was pushed to the ground by an agent who was approaching from behind, handcuffed and detained in a small room for many hours. As I stated, I missed my flight, my wedding and was placed on a no-fly list.

  610. I've had a beard for years and never did anything special for it other than pert plus shampoo. I realized that I had to take care of my Garibaldi beard to keep it healthy so I decided to try this out over other products due to the amount of positive feedback. Here's what I found after using for a month....<br /><br />It adds shine to your beard which is nice and a little bit is all you need. After a month I'm only half way thru the tin. If you use too much you might feel greasy or waxy especially in the Mustache. However there is not much hold as it is a conditioner not a styling gel. I do feel like it does a fair job conditioning. One thing I really don't like is if you eat food crumbs and salt easily stick to the beard even several hours after applying. You have to comb or remove the good particles after you eat which in turn makes your fingers oily or greasy. The smell is pleasant and not too strong and organic in nature.<br /><br />This is my first product for my beard I've tried so I don't know the best way to apply. Would be nice to have a how to video to get the most out of the product.<br /><br />Overall I do like the product and I do notice the difference days I don't use it. I'm just not sold on it yet. I want to try other beard products before I find what is right for me. Perhaps the extra strength honest Amish balm or a leave in conditioner you only have to use once or twice weekly. After trying more products this maybe the product for me I just don't know yet til I try more but I will say its a high quality product worth trying out backed up by a reputable company.

  613. The short version: Amish Beard Balm will make your beard more manageable, smell awesome (but not pungent or strong), and make it look much more well-groomed and polished.<br /><br />About the only thing I dislike, or, not really dislike, but take in stride, is that due to the nature of it being a &#34;balm&#34;, if the ambient temperature or your fingers are cold it takes a few seconds to liquify. While you're waiting on it to melt (about 30 seconds), it feels &#34;grainy&#34;, but its not a big deal.<br /><br />The overall effect this has on a beard is amazing. It's not dramatic...in fact, its, subtle, but that's part of the beauty of it. The subtle &#34;hold&#34;, the subtle softness, the subtle glean or shininess, the subtle smell, it all adds up to a much improved presentation. I don't find it greasy at all; in fact, if its too greasy I would suspect a person is using way too much.<br /><br />This is a staple in my grooming regimen for sure. I echo the general consensus here: This stuff is great. To be fair, there are other great beard balms, oils, etc, worth checking out, but this one is a home run.

  640. I've had a beard for over 30 years, and have struggled on and off to find a good leave-in conditioner that does what I want: help keep my beard healthy, doesn't add unnecessary complications like styling wax or strong perfume, and helps stop skin flakiness. This does all that - my beard feels soft, if you use the right amount (a very SMALL amount - trial and error helps to find what that amount is for you) it doesn't feel greasy, there's a very subtle scent that I no longer notice (and no-one has ever mentioned to me), and I stopped having flakiness on the second day of use. This is excellent. I will continue to use this as long as I can.
  641. This left my beard shiny and wet. I didn't care for it.
  642. First, the scent. What about the scent? There is much to-do about the scent in the reviews and you may be afraid that the scent is &#34;strong&#34; or that you'll smell like licorice all the time. Don't be concerned. I have no idea what these people are on about. There is a hint of anise (black licorice) but I think the scent is a mix of spice notes and woodsy scents with maybe a tiny bit of anise. I think, personally, the top note is clove. Is it a strong scent? No, absolutely not. One single spritz of cologne is way stronger than this stuff. Will you smell it? Yes, faintly, and for a little bit until you either adjust or the scent fades away--it's hard to measure what is actually happening under one's nose. Having used it for a few days, my wife did not even notice the scent of it on me. In fact, for the sake of science, I put a lot on one morning, waited a few minutes, and had my wife give me a sniff from about 5 inches away. She said that she couldn't really smell anything at all. In any event, I think it smells quite good. (NOTE: If you cringe at the thought of wearing even the weakest scent, as some men do, Honest Amish makes an unscented version of this balm.)<br /><br />Does it work? Yes. My beard is softer and it looks nicer too. I'd recommend the product to anyone who uses a stronger soap for face cleaning as a strong soap turns your beard hair into steel wool. This, along with some good conditioner, helps put things back into shape.<br /><br />Does it help with the dreaded beard itch? Yes, and boy was I glad that it did.<br /><br />Does it help with the dreaded beardruff? Yes, my skin is regularly flaky with beards and this took care of that too.<br /><br />Is it greasy? Well, at first it is a little moist. After you put it on, it does seem to soak up very well such that you don't have any meaningful residue on your beard. If you use a lot, it'll be a bit greasy, but if you've used a beard oil before you should know what you're in for.<br /><br />Does it help with holding or shaping? Basically, no. It does contain wax, but this stuff is for conditioning. If you want a bit more hold, buy the heavy duty balm (and see my review on that.) I used this stuff in the early stages of my beard and switched to the heavy duty balm when my beard got longer and more unruly.<br /><br />Does a little go a long way? Yes, so don't be put off by what seems to be a small tin. You're supposed to apply this to a damp beard and the dampness helps the small amount of the product go even further. There's no &#34;set&#34; amount to use here, naturally. You can tailor it to your liking or your need for conditioning. I tend to use a good-sized portion, particularly as my beard gets longer and before I transition over to the Heavy Duty Beard Balm. Still, I'm not burning through tins. I've had the same tin for more than a year.<br /><br />Get it. Try it.<br /><br />A &#34;For The Ladies&#34; Edit, 11/29/15: My wife, for whatever reason, started using this on the ends of her hair. She's been doing it for months now and swears by it. So, I asked her why she likes it so much. She said that it keeps her ends moisturized and it has helped to eliminate split ends. She said she also thinks it would have useful application in controlling fly-aways while braiding. I'm pretty sure I have very little idea what that means.<br /><br />Does it help with holding or shaping? Basically, no. It does contain wax, but this stuff is for conditioning. If you want a bit more hold, buy the heavy duty balm (and see my review on that.) I used this stuff in the early stages of my beard and switched to the heavy duty balm when my beard got longer and more unruly.<br /><br />Does a little go a long way? Yes, so don't be put off by what seems to be a small tin. You're supposed to apply this to a damp beard and the dampness helps the small amount of the product go even further. There's no &#34;set&#34; amount to use here, naturally. You can tailor it to your liking or your need for conditioning. I tend to use a good-sized portion, particularly as my beard gets longer and before I transition over to the Heavy Duty Beard Balm. Still, I'm not burning through tins. I've had the same tin for more than a year.<br /><br />Get it. Try it.<br /><br />A &#34;For The Ladies&#34; Edit, 11/29/15: My wife, for whatever reason, started using this on the ends of her hair. She's been doing it for months now and swears by it. So, I asked her why she likes it so much. She said that it keeps her ends moisturized and it has helped to eliminate split ends. She said she also thinks it would have useful application in controlling fly-aways while braiding. I'm pretty sure I have very little idea what that means.
  643. Awesome product, awesome packaging. I love that it comes in the burlap bag, adds a touch of rugged manliness to it. ;)<br />I got this balm for my boyfriend just for something new and fun to try. It smells really good and seemed to work right away; after the first use his beard was softer! Some reviews noted that the smell faded over time, and I think it does, but not entirely.   645. I've enjoyed this beard balm quite extensively. I purchased the tin about four beards ago...I've been growing my beard for about two months, then hitting the rest button just to keep things fresh. I still have about a 1/5 of a tin left, so I think that it performs well from a value standpoint. If you are burning through this tin faster than that, you either have a beard that is old growth forest, or you are using way too much.<br /><br />For me, I use it in the morning after taking a shower. I take a portion of about a dime (much less when my beard is a young and full of dreams), rub it between my hands for about 3-5 seconds to warm/disperse it, then lightly spread it through my beard like I am doing some heavy pondering. It gives my beard a pleasant sheen, helps calm my unruly whiskers, and adds a pleasant smell that I've had described as &#34;Man. Your face smells like man.&#34;<br /><br />On a side note, one way to tell if you are using too much, brush your hand through your beard prior to bed (mutually pleasing). If your hand is covered in beard balm, you are probably using too much. For me, I find that it mostly dissipates by mid-afternoon.

It does not serve to tame the stray hairs but does soften the beard. With bi-daily use (alternating with mountaineer oil), I find that my beard is becoming more and more soft as time goes on.   726. Have had a beard for years but never let it grow out. When I finally tried I realized just how rough/wiry/dry/etc it was. Enter Honest Amish Beard Balm. Took a few weeks of daily use but now my bread is smooth, moisturized, delightful to smell and behold. After the shower I take a small dollop, warm it up in my hands and massage into my beard. Brush it into shape with a boar bristle brush and voila! Done.<br /><br />For anyone complaining about it leaving your face/hands/beard greasy: you're using too much. If you do put on too much, take a damp towel and wipe over your beard to remove some of the excess then brush again.<br /><br />Everyone has their own opinion as to the smell. My two cents: lemon grass and clove are the two main aromas. Not so much licorice. I love licorice and this ain't it. People apparently don't actually know what licorice smells like.
  727. I have had a short goatee for a while now, and every time I tried to go for anything longer I wound up trimming it back down to fight those wild hairs that would shoot straight out. I was looking for options to tame my unruly face mane when I stumbled across Honest Amish's amazing line of products. These guys have it down! Within only one use, my beard was noticeably softer and looked thicker. I honestly don't know how a beard balm can make such an amazing difference so quickly, but the results are right on my face for everyone to see. Needless to say, I've been inspired to experiment with some longer styles now, and my beard just keeps getting softer and softer. Beards are a whole different ball game when you have a downy blanket on your face, and your lady friend will thank you for it.<br /><br />As for the crazy people who have complained about not including an applicator in the reviews, they clearly must not have hands. The directions that come on the bag very clearly advise that you warm the product up in the palm of your hand until it melts, and then work it in to your beard with your fingers and a comb. No applicator needed, and it makes your hands soft too (another added bonus that your lady friend is sure to notice).<br /><br />A little goes a long way with this product, and even though the tin is small, you really don't need to use much. I only use enough to fit on one fingertip, and it successfully covers my whole goatee once it melts. If a few hairs decide to pop back out later in the day, or if I just want to bask in the softness and nice aroma, I sometimes pull out the comb and brush it a few times. The honest Amish residue on the comb serves as a nice touch up without overdoing it.<br /><br />If you have a beard, buy this product. If you don't have a beard, grow one and buy this product. If you're a lady, date a man with a beard, and then do them the favor of buying this product. Your face fur will never be the same.

Keeping it at room temperature will allow it to harden in a few hours, or you can put it in the fridge for a few minutes, so melting is not a big deal if you're at home. Recently they have come out with an oil in addition to the balm and I find the oil is less greasy while sacrificing some hold. For those of you who may not want something with such a strong scent, they do have an unscented version. The regular scent to me is kind of like a mix of sandalwood with a very small amount of vanilla in it. It's more masculine smelling then it sounds though. I have tried a bunch of brands so far and Honest Amish is my favorite.
  789. This stuff is awesome. Great smell, and leaves a beard much more manageable and soft!
  790. works great with the beard oil at keeping skin and hair healthy. love how soft it makes it no coarse or bristly here..
  791. Wouldn't beard without it. It has a natural scent to it. It's very pleasant to me and most importantly my wife likes it. This stuff has taken away the itchy scratchys of beard growing and the ingredients are pretty impressive.
  792. Initially I didn't like the smell, maybe expected something different. After couple of weeks tried it again and now I am very happy about how it smells and how it makes my beard shiny.

  806. Only reason I docked one star is because the price and shipping is a bit much for what you get. You can get 4 oz. of the Bay Lime beard conditioning oil for about the same price as the two-ounce Honest Amish. So far I am really liking the product though. The balm easily turns into oil after rubbing it gently between your fingers, and it works into your beard just as easily as a liquid oil based product. Has a barely detectable natural kind of scent once worked into beard. Leaves your beard smooth and gives it a slight sheen - not as shiny as an oil based product though. I love looking at the tin and label sitting on my bathroom counter, it makes me smile. Really cool image and neat little tin.

  842. This was a really pleasant surprise. I have a really rough beard and this stuff does a nice job of making it soft, holding it in place and giving a light shine. I never used a beard product before this. The smell is also quite nice, more of a natural 'outdoorsy' 'woodsman' type of smell.<br />Really happy I purchased this.<br /><br />Only drawback is melting point. This is hard at 60degrees and nearly melted at 70. Probably liquid at 80. With a container that bends easily (not sure it would seal fully) especially after a few drops. I am hesitant to take it someplace that it might be sideways or upsidedown and warm. Like a bag in a warm car or luggage... So I have to this time left it at home in upright position. I may be totally wrong here, but just being cautious. This also means that if its low 60s, applying the product is much more difficult than in the 70s or 80s. BUT this is all part of a natural product's characteristics. Like coconut oil. So i am happy.
  843. Awesome product! Bought as a gift for the boyfriend. The conditioner itself is light enough to not leave your hands oily, and soft enough that you'll want to run your hands through it all day. Has a pleasant earthy spicy smell, but it's subtle enough that it's not overpowering. (I personally wouldn't say it's black licorice, though I can see how some people could arrive there.) The packaging is very honest as well, it came in a burlap bag with a cardstock tag with instructions.<br /><br />My only concern is that it does contain nut oils, so it may be a downside for those who are allergic. We have family that is allergic, and I'm sad when they visit because his beard is not the same without this product!

It does indeed smell like Licorice to me. It's not a bad scent, but it is stronger than I expected and it does stay fragrant throughout the day. Keep that in mind.<br /><br />Application was easy enough. I'm about half way through my first jar. My itchiness and dryness has completely went away. I believe it is some softer, but not as soft as I was hoping it to be. Perhaps in time, or perhaps I need to add a conditioner to my routine. One thing I have noticed is it has added a great dear of lustrous shine to my red beard! In short, it has made my beard look a whole lot better and healthier! I like it.   851. I was slightly skeptical of this item, but bolstered by all of its positive reviews, I decided to give it a try for the sake of dealing with the three nightmarish aspects of beard ownership: dandruff, scratchiness, and softness.<br /><br />After using dandruff shampoo/conditioner solely for my beard for the last few years, I still hadn't managed to lick the dandruff/scratchiness demons and softness can always be improved upon.<br /><br />True to the descriptions of others, the paste itself is gritty and a teensy bit greasy to the touch. But after rubbing it into the palm for a minute and applying it to the beard, I was instantly won over. Beard is no longer showering my clothes with beardruff and it's soft as can be. I look forward to getting a final verdict from the lady friend when she returns.

  853. Seems to work as intended and I kinda like the smell. Unfortunately it was a hot day when this arrived on my doorstep and the contents were almost completely liquefied. I don't think I'll be using the rest of the container but may try ordering again when things cool down a bit here in Virginia. *Update 3/1/16* I decided to try ordering again during the cooler weather and have been happy with this product, so I'm adjusting my review score accordingly, but still... not worth buying online during hot weather.

  890. I have worn a beard for the last fifteen years with few exceptions. During that time, I never received a single compliment about my beard that did not come from my wife. I have been using this balm for about a month, and it has completely transformed my beard from a frizzy, uncontrollable mess into a beard that gives me confidence and looks pretty damn good. I am at about 3.5 months of growth now, and I get compliments on my beard almost daily, even while standing at a urinal... yeah, that one was a little awkward.<br /><br />I have not used any oils or balms in the past. I did not know there were such things available, so I have nothing to compare this to except for using no products at all. I know this one works for me, and I would not hesitate to recommend it to someone. Like others have said, if it is too oily, you are using too much. I use a portion a little larger than an average pea when my beard is damp after a shower, and my beard is never oily. Also, the scent is very mild and reminds me of Juicy Fruit chewing gum. You can't smell it at all after a few minutes, but if you have a decent 'stache you can taste it throughout the day- bonus.<br /><br />Do your beard a favor and pick this up along with a boars bristle brush. Also, check out the Honest Amish Etsy page for all of their other products. I won't beard without it again.

  893. So, I had a decently long beard, a lot of &#34;Duck Dynasty&#34; quips from random strangers wherever I went. However, it hadn't seem to grow in months. I had hit the dreaded TERMINAL LENGTH.<br /><br />I start researching balms and whatnot to find out if something could help and came across this product. The reviews all seemed good except for the &#34;scent&#34; people, but hey, $14? I'll give it a shot. So, ordered, and the balm arrived a few days later, all spiffily wrapped.<br /><br />But...what a small tin! I figured there was no way this stuff would last me more than two weeks, a month max, so I used it oh so sparingly. The scent didn't really bother me, but, honestly, its fairly strong, and you're putting it right on your face, so it smells stronger to you than it does to anyone else. I can see where some people would be turned off by it, but its very &#34;woodsy&#34; smelling, and more of a scent, less of an &#34;odor&#34; so I don't mind.<br /><br />After a few weeks of not noticing a difference, I realized how little I had actually used. This stuff goes a long way, much longer than I expected. So, I tried an experiment. I measured my beard, and vowed to use the balm once a day. At then end of the month, we'd see if there was any growth. 30 days later, lo and behold, I had gained between a quarter and a half inch of beard length.<br /><br />Now, does this product make your beard GROW? Probably not...but...it DOES keep you beard hair healthy. I have had FAR fewer stray hairs come out in my comb. I used to have 6-7 long hairs come off every stroke, now I usually just get the one occassional hair, which means less hair is coming out, and spending more time growing. I've been super impressed with the product, and two months after buying, and using it daily for a month and a half, I'm still not halfway done with the tin. Highly recommended.
  894. Goes perfect with the oil.
  895. I ordered this to give it a go in my beard. I liked the smell of the balm and it was not greasy at all. Very nice after a hot shower, my beard really liked this stuff and I could tell a difference right away. There are some small solids... or granules in this product. They melt away when heated by rubbing the balm between your hands, but I always seemed to have a few stuck between my fingers. I would have rather seen a smooth balm. Keep in mind that I am anything but a maker of balms and have no knowledge of the process. I did feel like this was a high quality item and I will get more when mine is gone.
  896. My beard didn't get super soft and smooth overnight, but after a few applications I noticed my facial hair wasn't quite as coarse.   900. After seeing all the positive feedback about this product I decided to try it out for myself. I was in the service for 8 yrs so a post service beard was just so right for me. I had no clue what beard balm was, I thought shampooing it was good for my beard. Little did I know, it takes a lot of care. After about 4 months of solid growth I really started looking into beard oil/balm. So here I am now day 3 of using honest Amish, I gotta say it has really tamed my beard looks full, and feels great. As far as the smell I like it, it's a little strong smelling it straight out of the can. After applying maybe half a dime size amount into my beard the smell was real clean and faint. I can only imagine after a whole van it only gets better looking and stronger looking beard so that's why I'm giving this product a 5!!
  901. Hey Guys, So I would consider myself an avid beard grower. I have had a beard for quite sometime and or atleast facial hair. My girlfriend has seen my face shaved to the skin twice in 6 1/2 years. This time around I have been thinking of really taking the beard to the next level like \\"fear the beard\\" status. But, I realized I need some help since I work in a professional environment. It needs to be presentable. Once it started getting pretty long I had some flakes and irritation that I have really only had when its too short, that I have NEVER had before with length and the sides were curling a bit. I read about this product (thank you for the reviews) and jumped on it. I absolutely love this product....love. So that is my credibility. Size: ONLY REASON IT almost got 4 STARS...I want more lol Quality: Mine arrived melted, but don't do what I did and use it right away. Shake it up and put it in the fridge for a minutes (says it clear in the directions by the way).It has a grainy feel to it but dissolves into oil right away. Smell: I love it because its not fruity or flowery or overwhelming. Its woodsy....almost hemp like but not with the \\"Oh I know that smell\\" type of thing. It is pleasant and subtle. Girlfriend loves it too. Application: Very easy, adds to my morning routines now. Aftermath: leaves you beard kind of shiny but doesn't actually...mold your beard it does help you shape it a bit. But its not like a wax that you can make your beard do flips with. Overall: I will always have this product for the lifetime of my beard...HIGHLY recommend.

  911. Before, Beard was a bit crude. He was drinking Wild Turkey out of the bottle and smoking Marlboro Reds all day. Though I can't prove it, I believe at night while I was asleep he was going out, robbing liquor stores and pushing down old women in the street. It was definitely putting a strain on our relationship. I needed help.<br /><br />I searched for answers and found a lot of options, but decided to try this in hopes of &#34;refining&#34; Beard. At first, I was drawn to the novelty of the brand, packaging and description. So, why not? At least I would have a cool tin if it failed. Maybe something to put a reminder of Beard in when we parted ways?<br /><br />Now? After a few days use, I've noticed a change. Beard has started to drink Scotch and smoke Cubans. In fact, his drinking and smoking has cut back and he's being a lot more polite. Heck, he's started to talk about wanting to go on a fox hunt!<br /><br />Thanks Honest Amish, you've helped us start to rebuild our failing relationship!<br /><br />(Jokes aside, my beard actually has begun to feel and look healthier. Though not often, my job does require a professional appearance and I do feel this product will help me achieve that while retaining the manliness of a beard. So, I'm pleased with my purchase.)
  912. I had an issue with flaking and serious irritation. but started using this product, and it all went away. my beard is now soft and seems to be growing much quicker.
  913. Just got my second can of this stuff. I started using it back in November with probably 3-4 weeks of growth. I basically follow the instructions as far as application, but I usually apply a little bit at the time through out the day. If you put too much in at once it can make a dark beard look greasy. If my beard ends up dry from some reason I will run hot water over the side of the can to warm it up to liquid then put a lot in. Warming it up just helps in getting down deep in the hair and on the skin. If it doesn't work the first few times you try it don't throw it away. Stick with it for a few weeks and it will really do what they say it will, but it don't happen in one application. Smells great too...very woodsy, piney smelling stuff which goes well with a big burly beard.

  917. I'm fairly certain I'm literally rubbing actual butter into my beard. But in a good way.<br /><br />When mine arrived, some of the ingredients had separated, but the instructions tell you how to re-mix them (basically heat and shake, I chose to heat it under hot running water, but the instructions also suggest just leaving it on a windowsill, which would also work, it has a very low melting point).<br /><br />The scent is hard to describe, but pleasant. My wife says it's lemony, but I'm not so sure, and I don't see any citrus fruits listed in the ingredients (though I'm not sure they listed all of them). I see a lot of people describing it as a black licorice smell, but no. The Honest Amish beard *WAX* smells like licorice (anise, actually), but this product does not. It's a very different smell from the wax. The scent fades pretty quickly anyway, so it shouldn't noticeable to anyone who doesn't have their nose buried in your beard.<br /><br />As far as the beard goes, this product really does help with softening and even some mild styling/straightening of the beard (it doesn't have any real *hold* but it does make the beard more manageable). And it does eliminate the occasional itch, as well.<br /><br />It is made of butters and oils, so if you overdo it, you'll be a bit oily, but it absorbs pretty well.

  935. In short: quite good.<br /><br />In detail:<br /><br />1) The packaging was sweet, came with instructions and advice, nice bag and the sorts.<br />2) The price was on the higher end, but with the size of the can given the amount used per apply, it is well placed.<br />3) The scent is not bad, not especially good either. Non of the people around me commented on its existence even when I asked if I smell funny; guess it does disappear after a while. Just be aware that it exists once you apply.<br />4) The delivery was one day late, but the likes happen, so I would say arrives on time more or less.<br /><br />Now, the important stuff:<br /><br />5) My beard did feel considerably smoother after about a week of daily applying; but I did also oil my beard with olive oil (balm in the morning, oil at night; my beard is very dry, so I need all the oils I can get).<br />6) It does not have any significant hold, so don't count on it getting the wild hairs down; trimming does that job better. Or, just apply balm daily till your beard soften at a longer length allowing better combing down.<br />7) It does help give the beard a thicker, fuller look... My beard is not the thickest, but also not patchy, yet it feels darker after balming.<br /><br />Conclusions:<br />- Balm does help get a better beard look.<br />- Balm does NOT equal wax; try the heavy balm or simply wax to keep your hairs down

Heck, I think I could melt the can just by holding it in my palm for a few seconds. The Honest Amish canister arrived in a small burlap sack, but the can was pretty well dented! In a nutshell, it didn't do a darn thing for me. Nothing. Nada. Zilch. I applied it daily for several days, increasing the amount each time. There was absolutely no perceptible change in beard softness, manageability, or sheen. It seemed like a lot of money for no results whatsoever.   979. I got this because I have been looking for a way to soften my beard. My beard is pretty course and always feels dry and brittle. I have tried commercial beard oil (it was ok) and a cream hair conditioner that I actually leave in (works the best but doesn't last long). Reading the reviews, I was hesitant about this one. There were far more positive reviews than negative so I went for it. The smell is pleasant while in the tin. When you put it on, the pleasant earthly smell doesn't last long and for me it was replaced by this slight smell of rancid oil. I have smelled shae butter than has gone off and it was similar. I was running errands and had to just deal with it. After a few hours the rancid smell was gone. The part I don't like is how oily this stays. Jojoba is usually quickly absorbed and my beard doesn't feel oily, but something in this made it a mess. While driving, I looked down at my steering wheel and noticed one side was very shiny and slick. I thought that was weird and then I noticed oily finger prints as well. It hit me that it was on the left side and I had been stroking my beard with my left hand. Later I took a phone call and when I lowered the phone, oil was smeared all over the screen. I am sending this back and will stick with a homemade beard oil that is pure jojoba and some essential oils.

It takes but a small dab to add life to your facial hair. In your hands it has a partial sandy texture, but after a quick rub together it's ready to be applied. There are essential oils in it so there will be a slight oily feel. Once applied, rub into beard, mustache, whatever. I used a beard comb to work in thoroughly. It really helps all the wild hairs and areas that grow faster lay down properly. I've been using this for 3 weeks now and not sure how I've grown a beard without it.

  1012. This compound is absolutely grand, and it has turned out to be a great investment for my beard and the health of my facial follicles. Genuine surprise greeted my psyche after I began using a beard conditioner (this is the only brand of beard conditioner I have ever used, so take my review with a grain of salt, for there could be something equally good on the market - I would not know). I immediately noticed a different in the texture and quality of my whiskers from the initial use, and have continued to use the tin nearly every day.<br />This is a leave-in conditioner, as the site label asserts, so to really receive the complete benefit of using such a product, it is necessary to put it in sometime in the morning and leave it in for at least eight or nine hours, but I generally leave it there until right before I decide to climb into bed. I would say my whiskers are on the prolific side of things, but only about 4 inches long; I use slightly under a large lima bean-size amount, work it into a non-sedimentary oil on my palms, and then just rub it as evenly as I can throughout my beard. That's it.<br />Perchance I shall try others in the future, but as a first-round pick, I believe I did very well selecting this product. If you are considering others, I would try a small two ounce tin of this first.

  1048. I realize it doesn't show that I purchased this item from Amazon, however a friend of mine ordered it for me off here using their account so I did indeed get it from Amazon. Anyhow, I love this product. I just recently decided to make the jump from having a beard to &#34;growing my beard out&#34; for about 2 years I had a beard grown that I trimmed every other week to keep it at a size 5 on my hair clipper setting. So I made the decision to purchase this product because basically every time I'd let my beard get longer than a size 5 it would start to get wiry and sort of curly. Basically it would start to look kind of &#34;scraggly&#34;.<br /><br />So I decided to order this, not only to help tame my beard hairs but also because I thought &#34;well it claims to promote healthier beard growth&#34; so it's basically like a win/win situation. Anyway, since day one of using this product I have loved it. It spreads very easily among my beard. It smells not girly in the slightest and the scent fades rather quickly even if you don't dig it. The thing I love most about it is it does help manage your beard. Goes on kind of greasy however throughout the day my beard hairs absorb the product so by the end of the day when I feel my beard it feels like there isn't any product in it at all. My only gripe about this product is that it does add a shine to your beard. I don't really see a perk to having your beard &#34;shiny&#34; except maybe to draw people's gaze to the amazing piece of art on your face known as a beard. You can however tell by my 5 star rating that the shine it produces isn't bad enough to dock it a star.<br /><br />After using about half of this container which seems to last a rather long time, it's definitely worth the price paid, I decided to try a &#34;similar&#34; beard product also in a can known as &#34;Beard Balm&#34;, I don't know if I am allowed to discuss other products by name? But I just did. Anyway, that product was terrible, it had a disgusting bathroom cleaner antiseptic smell (that lingered for hours) and it made my beard feel very thick and dirty (not &#34;thick&#34; in a good way). No matter how little of the that balm that I used it still made my hairs clump together and feel dirty and unlike this balm, at the end of the workday it still felt as dirty and clumpy as it did at the time of application.<br /><br />I do not work for Honest Amish but I can say without a doubt that as long as I have a beard I will have a tin of Honest Amish in my bathroom. ALSO, just a hint that I learned recently to help manage your beard, after you shower style your beard the way you'd like it to stay while it's still wet and let it dry naturally (if of course you've got like an hour before you need to leave the house). It really works. Then just apply some of this balm (once dry) your good to go. I usually rub two fingers in the balm and then smear it together in my left palm and apply in sections to my beard, takes about 2-3 minutes to work through my entire beard.

  1069. First, I am funny about smell. I generally don't want to smell anything. And I do not like the taste or smell of cloves or licorice. That said, I am addicted to the smell of this product. I don't know why, but the smell makes me feel good. It is subtle. My wife had difficulty smelling it after a few hours of application, and she is a super smeller. I wish the odor lasted longer.<br /><br />At the age of 53, this is my first beard. I never thought I could stand it. This product is phenomenal. I liked it on the first application. But, the real difference came a week later. My beard became softer and softer. This product is not about hold. It is about softening and conditioning so that hold is not needed. I started my beard 3 months ago. It was scratchy and itchy beyond belief. A co-worker talked about beard balm. I had some jojoba oil that I started rubbing in, and that was an improvement. Next I bought a dollar (from Dollar Tree) tin of cocoanut oil. It also had jojoba oil, but included paraffin and petrolatum. This seemed nice, but everything I touched afterwards became greasy. It was very difficult to wash off my hands. And stray hairs even became more stray. So I ordered Honest Amish Beard Balm from Amazon. This product is the antithesis of greasy. I need not wash my hands after application. This stuff is really good for the skin. I couldn't believe now much nicer my fingernails and cuticles became after just one week of beard application. I would use this stuff anywhere on my body. Probably really good for your feet. I use it on my beard more than once a day. I detect no build up. My beard is just soft and clean feeling. I have searched Etsy and Amazon for products that might offer alternative scents. But, I think none of them could probably match the conditioning of all the ingredients in Honest Amish. I highly recommend it. I don't write reviews often, but I felt compelled to share the joy I am experiencing. Get you some.<br /><br />Cons, only one. The product is gritty in the can. Solution, make sure you give a few seconds of rubbing in hands to totally liquify before applying. Otherwise, you may be combing out little nuggets of product.is gritty in the can.   1097. This stuff is great! I have previously tried to grow a beard, and decided to trim and shave my whiskers because of the dreaded beard itch. I tend to have dry skin problems in the winter, and while I've always wanted to grow my beard during this time of year, it also tends to dry my face. After browsing a few beard forums and seeing this product mentioned a few times, I decided to wander over to Amazon and purchase this beard balm. I now use it daily. It has made my beard very soft and manageable, while taming some of the stray whiskers that tend to stick straight out rather than fall with the flow of my beard. If the right amount is used, then it will present a nice softness to the skin that doesn't feel greasy.<br /><br />THE SMELL - I have seen mention of a smell in some reviews of this product. While it certainly does have a unique smell to it, the smell is natural. My nose doesn't detect any sort of artificial fragrance, and the smell seems all natural. If you are familiar with the smell of Cocoa Butter, then you will instantly be able to pick it up. It was definitely the main scent that I could detect. My wife cannot smell any distinct scent, even when her nose is touching my beard.<br /><br />THE SIZE - Be warned, you may be disappointed in the size of this product when it arrives at your door. While I was certainly surprised, I can say that a little bit of this product really does go a long way, and it really does help with growth and softness.<br /><br />RECOMMENDATIONS - Attached is a photo of the amount that I use. It is plenty to allow for entire beard coverage, while any remaining balm I have left, I apply to the rest of my face to prevent any dryness. The excess balm works great to hydrate and protect skin all day! Simply take a small amount with your finger tip, and rub well in between your hands. The paste will melt down into the consistency of an oil, and spread evenly throughout your beard. If too much of the balm is used, it will leave the beard looking slightly oily and over-conditioned in the sun.<br /><br />After seeing how much this product has helped maintain my beard, I am interested in trying some other products from the company!   1120. Suddenly I am a lumbersexual after 35 years of trimming a beard. Well, okay then, let's try putting some oily stuff that smells like tea ( according to a surprised co-worker). It feels like gritty wax that melts into perfumed oil in your hands as you rub them together and to then rub them into your beard. At first oily and shiny, the next day the beard feels soft and springy and stays that way until you re-apply the balm. I expect the little tin will last a few months of twice weekly applications (maybe three times) and then I'll see how I feel after its been gone for a while. It's noticeably more effective if you use it once you get out of the shower, while your beard is still wet. It will look and feel healthier instantly.<br /><br />The scent won't please everyone. It's not bad, it's just not what I'm looking for in a beard oil. Thankfully it's not particularly potent--unless someone else is within inches of your beard, you're likely to be the only one to notice. If you want an idea of what it smells like, go to the spice aisle at the store and open a jar of Chinese Five-Spice (think clove and anise). This is exactly what it smells like. My brain associates this scent with stir fry. I don't want to smell stir fry all day. When I'm ordering my third can I'll be getting the unscented, melting it, and adding a few of my own essential oils to craft my own scent.
